isis.stitle: Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide - BE 200, CE 200, CE 300 Model - LIGHT SYSTEMS - Red And Amber Pupil Warning Lights - Pupil Warning Lights - Virginia Warning Lights

svcproc.title: Pupil Warning Lights - Virginia Warning Lights

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection Management
svcsubproc.para:
This section is for those busses that are wired with the Virginia Warning Lights wiring configuration. If the bus is NOT wired with this configuration, then go to Red & Amber Pupil Warning Lights Inputs from Steering Wheel Switches
to begin diagnostics.

note.para: The testing method for troubleshooting the electrical systems portrayed in this manual is a basic voltage test. An alternative method of checking for voltage drops within a given circuit may be a quicker method of identifying an exact problem.
The virtual fuse in the ESC will trip during a short. To reset the fuse, the key switch must be cycled.

svcsubproc.para: A fault in the Virginia warning lights will be apparent when the pupil warning lights are activated and the red or amber pupil warning lights do not flash. The ESC will also log a diagnostic trouble code (DTC) when there is a short in pupil warning lights. Problems in the pupil warning lights circuits can be caused by burned out lamps, a short, an open, or a problem in the ESC.

figure.caption: Virginia Warning Lights Inputs Circuit Diagram - Always Refer to Circuit Diagram Book for Latest Circuit Information

calloutgroup.callout1: (1005) ZERO VOLT REFERENCE LOCATED RIGHT SIDE INSTRUMENT PANEL
(1006) (1007) BODY BUILDER CONNECTOR LOCATED LEFT SIDE VEHICLE AT FLASHER PLATE
(1600) (1602) SYSTEM CONTROLLER LOCATED INSIDE RIGHT SIDE DASH PANEL
J2 J38 FLASHER PLATE TO DASH
SPL-20 SPL-22 IGNITION ACCESSORY FEED SPLICE
SPL-40 SPL-42 ZERO VOLT REFERENCE SPLICE

table.title: Virginia Warning Lights Input Circuits Voltage Tests

entry.para: Check with ignition position on and override switch connector (C33) disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals. Also check turn signal assemblies for damage or corrosion.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Override switch (C33) cavity 2 to ground
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing, check for blown chassis fuse F14. Also check for open or short in circuits 16 BLK 83 and A13AB.
Override switch (C33) cavity 5 to ground
0 volts
If voltage is present or meter reads open circuit, check for open or short in circuits 16 BLU 2, 16 BLU 1, A9J, A9C and A9H.
Also ensure proper zero volt reference signal from ESC connector (1600) pin 3.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

entry.para: Override switch (C33) cavity 5 to 6
0 volts
If voltage is present or meter reads open circuit, check for open or short in circuits 16 BRN 54 and A89DD.
If circuits check good and switch is still faulty, replace override switch.
Check with ignition position on and flasher start switch connector (C32) disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals. Also check turn signal assemblies for damage or corrosion.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Flasher start switch (C32 cavity 5 to ground.
0 volts
If voltage is present or meter reads open circuit, check for open or short in circuits 16 BLU 2, 16 BLU 1, A9J, A9C and A9H.
Also ensure proper zero volt reference signal from ESC connector (1600) pin 3.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

entry.para: Flasher start switch (C32 cavity 5 to 6.
0 volts
If voltage is present or meter reads open circuit, check for open or short in circuits 16 RED 39 and A89AA.
If circuits check good and switch is still faulty, replace flasher start switch.

para.emph: Stop Arm Cancel Switch (C34) Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with ignition position on and stop arm cancel switch connector (C34) disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals. Also check turn signal assemblies for damage or corrosion.

entry.para: Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Stop arm cancel switch (C34) cavity 2 to ground.
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing, check for blown chassis fuse F14. Also check for open or short in circuits 16 BLK 83 and A13AB.
Stop arm cancel switch (C34) cavity 2 to 3.
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short in circuits 16 BLU 63 and A89MM.

para.emph: Master Flasher Switch (C1) Right Hand Switch Panel Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with ignition position on and master flasher switch in right hand switch panel connector (C34) disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals. Also check turn signal assemblies for damage or corrosion.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Master flasher switch (C1) cavity 2 to ground.
0 volts
If voltage is present or meter reads open circuit, check for open or short in circuits 16 BLU 2, 16 BLU 1, A9J, A9C and A9H.
Also ensure proper zero volt reference signal from ESC connector (1600) pin 3.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

entry.para: Master flasher switch (C1) cavity 2 to 3.
0 volts
If voltage is present or meter reads open circuit, check for open or short in circuits 16 RED 30 and A89KK.
If circuits check good and switch is still faulty, replace master flasher switch.

J9 J10 LEFT HAND BODY TO REAR CAP

J77 LEFT RED AMBER WARNING LIGHT TO REAR CAP

J79 RIGHT REAR RED WARNING LIGHT TO REAR CAP

SPL-33 WARNING LIGHTS, RIGHT AMBER - FRONT/REAR SPLICE

note.para: Before testing any red or amber pupil warning light circuits, check individual bulbs to ensure that they are not burnt out.

table.title: Virginia Amber Pupil Warning Lights Circuit Tests

para.emph: Amber Pupil Warning Lights Voltage Checks

entry.para: Check with ignition on, amber pupil warning lights connectors disconnected and amber pupil warning lights activated.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals. Also check turn signal assemblies for damage or corrosion.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Left front amber PWL connector (J85) cavity 1 to ground

note.para: A load device, such as a test light, must be used in parallel with voltmeter probes to read an accurate voltage.

entry.para: Flashing between 12 ± 1.5 volts and 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to ground in circuits 16 PNK 24, A89XX, A89YY and A89SS.
Also insure proper voltage out of ESC.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

entry.para: Left front amber PWL connector (J85) cavity 1 to 2

note.para: A load device, such as a test light, must be used in parallel with voltmeter probes to read an accurate voltage.

entry.para: Flashing between 12 ± 1.5 volts and 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to high in circuit 16 WHT I.
Right front amber PWL connector (J86) cavity 1 to ground

note.para: A load device, such as a test light, must be used in parallel with voltmeter probes to read an accurate voltage.

entry.para: Flashing between 12 ± 1.5 volts and 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to ground in circuits 16 PNK 25, A89LL, A89ZZ and A89JJ.
Also insure proper voltage out of ESC.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

entry.para: Right front amber PWL connector (J86) cavity 1 to 2

note.para: A load device, such as a test light, must be used in parallel with voltmeter probes to read an accurate voltage.

entry.para: Flashing between 12 ± 1.5 volts and 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to high in circuit 16 WHT J.
Left rear amber PWL connector (J77) cavity 1 to ground

note.para: A load device, such as a test light, must be used in parallel with voltmeter probes to read an accurate voltage.

entry.para: Flashing between 12 ± 1.5 volts and 0 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to ground in circuits 16 ORN 24, 16 PNK 24, A89XX, A89YY and A89SS.
Also insure proper voltage out of ESC.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

Right rear amber PWL connector (J78) cavity 1 to ground

Also insure proper voltage out of ESC.

If voltage is missing, check for open or short to high in circuit 16 WHT C.

entry.para: 12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to high in stop arm ground circuit to ground stud on flasher plate.
Check with red pupil warning lights deactivated and stop arm relay disconnected.

note.para: Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals. Also check turn signal assemblies for damage or corrosion.
Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: Bench test relay . If relay fails bench test, replace and check for faults.
Test Points
Spec.
Comments
Stop arm relay cavity 86 to ground.
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing, check for blown fuse #22. Also check for open or short to ground in circuit 16 BLK 63.
Stop arm relay cavity 86 to 85.
0 volts
If voltage is present, check for open or short in circuits 16 WHT 63 and A89HH.
While meter is still connected to stop arm relay from cavity 86 to 85, activate red pupil warning lights.
Stop arm relay cavity 86 to 85.
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to ground in circuits 16 WHT 63 and A89HH.
Also insure proper ground signal on system controller (1601) pin A.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE 4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

para.hotlnk: Refer to ESC Replacement in this manual.

entry.para: Leave red pupil warning lights activated.
Stop arm relay cavity 30 to ground.
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing, check for blown fuse #22. Also check for open or short to ground in circuit 16 BLK 63.
Stop arm relay cavity 30 to ground.
12 ± 1.5 volts
If voltage is missing, check for open or short to ground in circuit 16 BLU 63.
If circuits check good and stop arm is still faulty, replace stop arm.
